title_full:
Adult Jazz

              —
              So Sorry So Slow
            
              (Spare Thought)
label: Spare Thought
blush
description:
Poet, performer and NTS host Natalia Panzer teams up with Voice Actor’s Levi Lanser on 'key', a hazed fuzz of spoken word draped in lush, romantic atmospheres and half-heard samples. Properly delicate, weird, polychromatic pulp for fans of Voice Actor, Salenta + Topu, Laila Sakini, Coby Sey, Tricky, Jörg Follert.

There's a soft power to 'key' that comes as a surprise; initially its pebbly kicks and lopsided piano drench Panzer's downplayed, stateless voice, almost vanishing into the room's... more

label: Mondoj
description:
Polish vocalist/multi-instrumentalist Antonina Nowacka returns with a mesmerising weave of wordless, operatic vocals, early music and a kind of fractal ambience last heard on Kara-Lis Coverdale’s totemic Grafts, arranging zither, organ, ocarina and '90s synths for an album that sits half way between New Age and the electro-acoustic avant garde.

Nobody sings quite like Antonina Nowacka. Her voice took us by surprise on 2020's 'Lamunan', an album that she dreamt up in a cave in Indonesia... more

label: Warm Winters Ltd.
description: Premiere vinyl edition of Carme López’ debut album of entrancing bagpipe arrangements, on constant rotation here since it came out on tape earlier this year. Unravelling forms of early music and funereal, queered droneworks full of strange tonalities, phased harmonics and curious subversions, ‘Quintela’ comes highly recommended If you’re into the verrrry slow chord-change organ dirges of Kali Malone, Pauline Oliveros’ Deep Listening or Yoshi Wada’s foundational bagpipe... more

title_full:
Clarissa Connelly

              —
              World of Work
            
              (Warp Records)
label: Warp Records
description:
Inspired by French philosophy, medieval letters and romantic poetry, Clarissa Connelly's first Warp full-length is an ornate lattice of Celtic and Scandinavian history and mythology, packed with heady prog-folk epics that tumble into church bell snippets and ambient choral workouts. Ambitious stuff, and all the better for it - RIYL Kate Bush, Julia Holter or ML Buch.

We've been drip-fed pieces of this one for months at this point, and thankfully the album itself is worth the wait. It works best in... more

label: Shukai
description:
The wide-eyed, theatric art-pop and psych-folk wonders of Svitlana Nianio’s early band, Cukor Bila Smert’, come to light via Ukrainian reissue specialists Shukai on this mindboggling 31-track, 90 minute anthology of studio recordings made between 1990-1993, contorting gothic folk around brittle, calypso-inspired drum loops and oddball new wave bullets, a sort of missing link on the spectrum between Broadcast, Stroom, Lubos Fiser and Les Disques Du Crépescule.

Cukor Bila Smert’ (trans:... more

title_full:
Harry Gorski-Brown

            —
            Durt Dronemaker After Dreamboats

Hmot

              —
              There Will Come Gentle Rain
            
              (Warm Winters Ltd.)
label: Warm Winters Ltd.
description:
Teaming up with Rupert Clervaux, Adela Mede, Eldar Tagi and Tuvan vocalist Sainkho Namtchylak, Stas Shärifullá (aka HMOT) digs into his academic research on collective memory and sonic traditions on his latest Warm Winters plate, deconstructing folk legends and cultural dissonance in the process.

It's fitting that the first sound we hear on 'There Will Come Gentle Rain' is an acoustic twang, that roots the album in folk traditions before it veers off into the unknown. The most... more

label: ESCHO
description:
Chinah's Fine, aka the sampled voice on Two Shell's 'Home', comes correct on her debut solo album, focusing her songwriting and coming up with a deceptively minimal, electronically-enhanced vision of homespun folk-pop - somewhere between Mazzy Star and ML Buch.

Even though 'Rocky Top Ballads' is Fine's first fully fleshed-out solo offering, she operates from the center of Denmark's fertile alt-pop scene. One half of Coined alongside Astrid Sonne, a part of Clarissa Connelly's Canons group... more

label: Hyperdub
description:
Arriving on Hyperdub for their first proper solo release in ages, Mica Levi delivers a 17 minute (12 on the digitals) orchestral dream pop epic, dispersing hallucinatory vocals buried in silvery clouds of strings and a motorik rhythm, somewhere in the vicinity of work by Dean Blunt and A.R. Kane, but ultimately just Mica’s thing.

There's a fantastical quality to Levi's music that's present even in their most stripped-to-the-bone productions, from 2017's DDS-released classic 'Delete Beach' to 2020's... more

label: Mappa Editions
description:
Copenhagen-based Slovakian artist Michaela Turcerová figures out a new language for the saxophone on 'alene et', taking the instrument's incidental sounds - like key presses and breathy exhalations - and transforming them into complex rhythms and hissing textures. RIYL Bendik Giske, Pita or Nakibembe Embaire Group. 

Turcerová covered her sax in microphones to producer 'alene et', working out exactly how each gesture might sound if it was amplified in a different way. And it was worth... more

title_full:
mu tate

              —
              wanting less
            
              (Warm Winters Ltd.)
label: Warm Winters Ltd.
description:
Following a run of blissed 'n dubbed plates for 3XL and Utter, Mu Tate descends on Warm Winters with a low-lit suite of jazz-tinged, bass-heavy weightless psychedelia - essential listening for fans of Huerco S., Malibu, early Space Afrika...

Not exactly beatless and not quite ambient, Strekalov's latest full-length dilates his influences - from breathy jazz to fringe club styles - emphasizing the fine, filigree details without losing the pulse. On opener 'your host', vanishing rhythms flicker into... more

title_full:
Nilüfer Yanya

              —
              My Method Actor
            
              (Ninja Tune)
label: Ninja Tune
description:
On her third album, Nilüfer Yanya preserves the subtlety of 2022's 'PAINLESS', using the concept of method acting as a metaphor for an intense transitional phase in her career..

When Yanya was researching method acting, she noticed parallels with her own process. The emotional strain and the energy an actor needs to feed off resonated with her as she grappled with changes in her life, as she switched record labels, moved house and returned from a grueling tour. All the questions that... more

title_full:
Sun Kit

              —
              All The Patterns Inside
            
              (Hyperdelia)
label: Hyperdelia

title_full:
Ulla & Ultrafog

              —
              it means a lot
            
              (Motion Ward)
label: Motion Ward
description:
Fizzing thru the aether like a half-remembered dream, Ulla and Ultrafog's collaborative debut is a surreal shimmer of imploded shoegaze-y guitar riffs, thick subs and lassoed vocals. Like an especially dissociated strain of hypnagogic pop, its sequence of trace recollections netted into a syrup of entrancing and half-speed ambience comes highly recommended if you’ve enjoyed work by Perila, Romance, Vincent Gallo, claire rousay or Oval. 

Not quite as smoky and diaphanous as Ultrafog's... more

label: Horn Of Plenty
description:
Oh this is gorgeous; Warm Currency shimmer thru the folk mantle on 'Petals', returning to the excellent Horn of Plenty imprint with an intimate volume of soul-piercing preternatural spells that sublime dazed poetics, radio noise and found sounds in a mode that feels like a more autumnal, downcast companion to Jonnine’s ‘Southside Girl’ album from earlier this year, as well as those incredible Empress records no one ever seems to talk about anymore.

Matthew P. Hopkins and Mary... more

title_full:
Zaumne

              —
              Only Good Dreams for Me
            
              (Warm Winters Ltd.)
label: Warm Winters Ltd.
description:
Following heady sets for Mondoj and sferic, Polish producer Zaumne clears the air a little on 'Only Good Dreams For Me', spacing ASMR vocals around sparse, bass-heavy rhythms and 'SAW II'-strength atmospherics.

There's always been a darkness in Mateusz Olszewski's Zaumne productions, but it's the cracks of light that keep us coming back. And he's never shown quite so much light as he does here, integrating poetic passages and twisted movie snippets into his illbient collages. Natalia... more
